Engine
Class Tower

java.lang.Object
  Engine.Tower

public class Tower
extends java.lang.Object

This class represents a tower in the game. An object of type 'Tower' is able to decide which creeps to attack and attack on its own. Further it contains all relevant information about a tower.

Version:
0.1
Author:
Tosh

             int frz,
             int xpos,
             int ypos,
             int range,
             int cooldown,
             int cooldownLeft,
             java.lang.String shape)
The tower큦 constructor readying it for usage. In this function all the tower큦 variables are initialized. To do so, all of these need to be given. This means the value큦 reading out of database takes place in the Game class and not here.

public void setID(int ID)
Sets the tower큦 ID. Should usually not be used.

Parameters:

setTowerID

public void setTowerID(int towerID)
Sets the tower큦 type큦 ID. Should usually be used for upgrading the tower. Includes security query blocking wrong values.

Parameters:
towerID - the tower큦 type큦 ID. Used as reference to the database.
See Also:
getTowerID()

setOwnerID

public void setOwnerID(int ownerID)
Sets the tower큦 owner큦 ID. Should usually only be changed in case of a player disconnecting in game mode 'Tower Wars'. Includes security query blocking wrong values.

Parameters:
ownerID - the tower큦 owner큦 ID. Used to specify which player 1-6 owns the tower.
See Also:
getOwnerID()

setLife

public void setLife(int life)
Sets the tower큦 actual life. Includes security query blocking wrong values.

Parameters:
life - the tower큦 actual life as integer. Must be between 0 and maxLife. In the actual state of the game this is not just according to creeps not being able to damage towers.
See Also:
getLife()

setRange

public void setRange(int range)
Sets the tower큦 shooting range. Includes security query blocking wrong values.

Parameters:
range - the tower큦 shooting range in pixels. Must be greater than 0. Should be greater than 1/2 grid-field, so the tower can attack anything.
See Also:
getRange()

doAttack

public void doAttack(Engine.Creep[] listOfCreeps)
Procedures an attack by this tower. To do so it uses attack() which applies damage and splash damage to the creeps in listOfCreeps chosen by decideWhichToAttack. This decides which creep has the highest priority and actually just asks for the shortest way left. To use less time only creeps in range are tested, which are searched by findCreepsInRange(). This uses the position and range of this tower to find according creeps in listOfCreeps

Parameters:
listOfCreeps - the array of all creeps ingame.
See Also:
attack(Creep[] listOfCreeps, Creep victim), decideWhichToAttack(Creep[] creepsInRange), findCreepsInRange(Creep[] listOfCreeps, int x, int y, int range)
